intro: Syndesmis tavoyana, commonly known as the Tavoyan mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant belonging to the Loranthaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in regions of Thailand, Malaysia, and Indonesia. The plant has a woody stem and produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a leathery texture. Syndesmis tavoyana relies on host trees for water and nutrients, while it provides nectar to various pollinators.
